intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis calogramma, commonly known as the golden pleurothallis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Andes of South America. This epiphytic orchid is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found growing on trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to yellow. The plant is prized for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate under the right conditions. It requires high humidity and indirect light to thrive.
